Description of incident: A customer of the Rocky Mountain              Bank asked a bank employee to send certain loan statements to a representative              of the customer. The employee, however, inadvertently sent the e-mail              to the wrong Gmail address. Additionally, the employee had attached              a sensitive file to the e-mail that should not have been sent at all.              The attachment contained confidential information on 1,325 individual              and business customers that included their names, addresses, tax identification              or Social Security numbers and loan information.
